comments:
3.2 RC2

When a plug-in adds a listener to the Java Model that is broken, i.e. throws an exception JDT should deactivate the listener for the rest of the session.

Reason:

I have DALI in my workspace and it looks like they have a problem when I add a method to an enum. Anyway, I now get a dialog box saying "An error occured. See error log for details." a couple of times when switching between different Java editors. This makes the session pretty useless.

Closing the problematic editor is a workaround. But as soon as I reopen it I get those dialog boxes again.

Sorry, please ignore comment 1. It was for the corresponding DALI bug and not this one.

According to Daniel's comment the dialog box should not occur in RC2. See my comment in bug 139462 comment 3. I don't know who produced the dialog box. When debugging this I didn't get a dialog box anymore.
